programme.title: Dermot O'Leary's Taste of Ireland
programme.desc: Dermot travels to the gourmet capital of Ireland, Kinsale, where he learns about the quintessential ingredient seaweed before taking a chocolate making masterclass. He's then goes foraging for wild garlic before putting together a dish inspired by his travels with a Michelin starred chef

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James makes a crme brle for chocolatier Mark Tilling, enjoys a dish of cod from chef John Hooker and whips up a beef pie for singer Tony Hadley

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Hemel Hempstead husband and wife Hari and Rasika, Merseyside couple Kellie and Eric, and Northern Irish father and son Tony and Laurence use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants David, Samantha, Tom and Danae pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Paddy has a disastrous encounter, Lewis is unable to believe his brother has betrayed him, and Sarah helps Cain

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A local outcast who was controversially acquitted of murder years previously is the latest inductee into a post-operative heart rehab club. However following his arrival, some of the members' dreams of a second chance at life begin being cut short. Guest starring Keith Allen and John Thomson

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Casino Royale
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Daniel Craig in his first appearance as 007. James Bond is awarded his licence to kill and sets off in pursuit of Le Chiffre, a corrupt banker who finances terrorism. Realising that the desperate Le Chiffre needs to win big on the gaming tables of Montenegro to pay off a dangerous client, Bond formulates a plan to ruin him in a high-stakes poker game.

programme.title: The Reunion
programme.desc: When Annabelle confronts Richard about the cost of his actions, he agrees to a plan to divert the police's attention from Thomas. With Max in hospital following the fallout of the night prior, Thomas meets with Fanny who reveals a dark secret. Mystery thriller, starring Ioan Gruffudd, Dervla Kirwan and Richard Graves

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities including Jake Quickenden, Dom Lever, Katie Walsh and Lee Latchford-Evans. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James serves up a sea bass ceviche using a variety of unusual herbs, and chef Lesley Waters shares her beef stroganoff recipe. The host also reveals how to make the ultimate chicken pie, and treats DJ Jordan North, etiquette expert William Hanson, and chefs Richard Berlinet, Ashley Palmer-Watts and Dipna Anand to steak

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Jane and Mick from Chesterfield, multilingual Bilal and husband Joe from London, and couple Scarlett and Walter from London try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Iceland v Finland (Kick-off 5.00pm). Laura Woods presents all the action from the opening match of the tournament, as the Group A rivals meet at Arena Thun in Switzerland. Iceland are playing in their fifth consecutive Euros finals, with their best showing coming in 2013 when they reached the last eight. Finland reached the semi-finals on their tournament debut in 2005 and were quarter-finalists four years later, but have not won a match in their two appearances since then in 2013 and three years ago

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon tells Paddy he needs to start facing up to reality, Jacob comforts Sarah, and Vinny is awkward around Kammy

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Kevin heads to the hospital for his results without Abi, Maria frets when Gary misses Liam's birthday celebration, Alya gets wind of Dee-Dee's devious plan, and Bernie orders Brody to make amends with his mum

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Sarah was left in the stairwell of a Surrey car park in 2001. She is the youngest foundling to appear on the show. Also looking for answers is Chris who, at three months old, was dropped off at a childminder's near Kings Cross in London, 62 years ago. He still needs to know who his birth family is and why nobody ever returned to pick him up. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell host

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show hosted by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries

programme.title: The Reunion
programme.desc: When Annabelle confronts the real Alexis, lies unravel as the truth about what happened to Vinca on that night 25 years ago is revealed. When deadly consequences arise, Thomas struggles with what his return and obsession with Vinca has done to his friends and family. Manon and Pianelli question whether justice has been served

programme.desc: James cooks Korean-inspired dishes of lamb chop and mackerel, chef Chantelle Nicholson shares a delicious recipe for stuffed courgette flowers. The host also reveals how to make the perfect meringues while also treating singer Alfie Boe to a mouth-watering chicken Kyiv

programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. programme.title: The Chase

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Spain v Portugal (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from both teams' opening match in Group B, held at Stadion Wankdorf in Bern, Switzerland. These rivals met twice this year in April in the UEFA Nations League and world champions Spain won 4-2 way and 7-1 at home to demonstrate why they were the pre-tournament favourites to win this trophy. However, they were eliminated by hosts England in the quarter-finals three years ago and their best showing in the competition remains a third-place finish in 1997. Portugal are making their third consecutive appearance in the finals having never previously qualified, but were eliminated in the group stage in both 2017 and 2022

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Live and Let Die
programme.desc: Spy adventure that marks Roger Moore's debut as James Bond. Investigating the deaths of three British agents, Bond finds himself up against the mysterious "Mr Big", a New York drug baron with plans for world domination. The trail leads to New Orleans and the Caribbean, where Bond discovers a sinister voodoo cult and the beautiful tarot-card reader Solitaire.

programme.title: British Touring Car Championship Highlights
programme.desc: Steve Rider presents action from the fifth round of the season at Oulton Park, where the 13th, 14th and 15th races of the season took place. The title race is heating up at the halfway point of the season after Tom Ingram's first win of the campaign at Thruxton cut Ash Sutton's championship lead down to nine points. With commentary by from David Addison, analysis from Tim Harvey, Paul O'Neill and Jade Edwards, and reports by Louise Goodman

programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Paddy has a disastrous encounter, Lewis is unable to believe his brother has betrayed him, and Sarah helps Cain

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A local outcast who was controversially acquitted of murder years previously is the latest inductee into a post-operative heart rehab club. However following his arrival, some of the members' dreams of a second chance at life begin being cut short. Guest starring Keith Allen and John Thomson

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Casino Royale
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Daniel Craig in his first appearance as 007. James Bond is awarded his licence to kill and sets off in pursuit of Le Chiffre, a corrupt banker who finances terrorism. Realising that the desperate Le Chiffre needs to win big on the gaming tables of Montenegro to pay off a dangerous client, Bond formulates a plan to ruin him in a high-stakes poker game.

programme.title: The Reunion
programme.desc: When Annabelle confronts Richard about the cost of his actions, he agrees to a plan to divert the police's attention from Thomas. With Max in hospital following the fallout of the night prior, Thomas meets with Fanny who reveals a dark secret. Mystery thriller, starring Ioan Gruffudd, Dervla Kirwan and Richard Graves

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities including Jake Quickenden, Dom Lever, Katie Walsh and Lee Latchford-Evans. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James serves up a sea bass ceviche using a variety of unusual herbs, and chef Lesley Waters shares her beef stroganoff recipe. programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Jane and Mick from Chesterfield, multilingual Bilal and husband Joe from London, and couple Scarlett and Walter from London try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Iceland v Finland (Kick-off 5.00pm). Laura Woods presents all the action from the opening match of the tournament, as the Group A rivals meet at Arena Thun in Switzerland. Iceland are playing in their fifth consecutive Euros finals, with their best showing coming in 2013 when they reached the last eight. Finland reached the semi-finals on their tournament debut in 2005 and were quarter-finalists four years later, but have not won a match in their two appearances since then in 2013 and three years ago

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon tells Paddy he needs to start facing up to reality, Jacob comforts Sarah, and Vinny is awkward around Kammy

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Kevin heads to the hospital for his results without Abi, Maria frets when Gary misses Liam's birthday celebration, Alya gets wind of Dee-Dee's devious plan, and Bernie orders Brody to make amends with his mum

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Sarah was left in the stairwell of a Surrey car park in 2001. She is the youngest foundling to appear on the show. Also looking for answers is Chris who, at three months old, was dropped off at a childminder's near Kings Cross in London, 62 years ago. He still needs to know who his birth family is and why nobody ever returned to pick him up. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell host

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries

programme.title: The Reunion
programme.desc: When Annabelle confronts the real Alexis, lies unravel as the truth about what happened to Vinca on that night 25 years ago is revealed. When deadly consequences arise, Thomas struggles with what his return and obsession with Vinca has done to his friends and family. Manon and Pianelli question whether justice has been served

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James serves up a dish of roasted pineapple, ice cream and doughnuts while chatting to a man inspired to set up his own doughnut company when his children were diagnosed with food allergies. Chef Asma Khan provides authentic Indian cookery, and Lorraine Kelly and Marti Pellow are treated to an Arbroath smoked haddock omelette

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Mad and Josh, a mother and son from Oxford, Chelmsford twins Prabin and Pallavi, and Gail and Genny, a mother and daughter from Belfast try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Sarah from Altrincham, Jack from Sheffield, Ellie from Bedfordshire and Mo from Bristol pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Spain v Portugal (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from both teams' opening match in Group B, held at Stadion Wankdorf in Bern, Switzerland. These rivals met twice this year in April in the UEFA Nations League and world champions Spain won 4-2 way and 7-1 at home to demonstrate why they were the pre-tournament favourites to win this trophy. However, they were eliminated by hosts England in the quarter-finals three years ago and their best showing in the competition remains a third-place finish in 1997. Portugal are making their third consecutive appearance in the finals having never previously qualified, but were eliminated in the group stage in both 2017 and 2022

programme.title: Live and Let Die
programme.desc: Spy adventure that marks Roger Moore's debut as James Bond. Investigating the deaths of three British agents, Bond finds himself up against the mysterious "Mr Big", a New York drug baron with plans for world domination. The trail leads to New Orleans and the Caribbean, where Bond discovers a sinister voodoo cult and the beautiful tarot-card reader Solitaire.

Also looking for answers is Chris who, at three months old, was dropped off at a childminder's near Kings Cross in London, 62 years ago. He still needs to know who his birth family is and why nobody ever returned to pick him up. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell host

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show hosted by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries

programme.title: The Reunion
programme.desc: When Annabelle confronts the real Alexis, lies unravel as the truth about what happened to Vinca on that night 25 years ago is revealed. When deadly consequences arise, Thomas struggles with what his return and obsession with Vinca has done to his friends and family. Manon and Pianelli question whether justice has been served

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James cooks Korean-inspired dishes of lamb chop and mackerel, chef Chantelle Nicholson shares a delicious recipe for stuffed courgette flowers. The host also reveals how to make the perfect meringues while also treating singer Alfie Boe to a mouth-watering chicken Kyiv

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James serves up a dish of roasted pineapple, ice cream and doughnuts while chatting to a man inspired to set up his own doughnut company when his children were diagnosed with food allergies. Chef Asma Khan provides authentic Indian cookery, and Lorraine Kelly and Marti Pellow are treated to an Arbroath smoked haddock omelette

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Mad and Josh, a mother and son from Oxford, Chelmsford twins Prabin and Pallavi, and Gail and Genny, a mother and daughter from Belfast try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Sarah from Altrincham, Jack from Sheffield, Ellie from Bedfordshire and Mo from Bristol pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Spain v Portugal (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from both teams' opening match in Group B, held at Stadion Wankdorf in Bern, Switzerland. These rivals met twice this year in April in the UEFA Nations League and world champions Spain won 4-2 way and 7-1 at home to demonstrate why they were the pre-tournament favourites to win this trophy. However, they were eliminated by hosts England in the quarter-finals three years ago and their best showing in the competition remains a third-place finish in 1997. Portugal are making their third consecutive appearance in the finals having never previously qualified, but were eliminated in the group stage in both 2017 and 2022

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Live and Let Die
programme.desc: Spy adventure that marks Roger Moore's debut as James Bond. Investigating the deaths of three British agents, Bond finds himself up against the mysterious "Mr Big", a New York drug baron with plans for world domination. The trail leads to New Orleans and the Caribbean, where Bond discovers a sinister voodoo cult and the beautiful tarot-card reader Solitaire.
